Spain, the world's top exporter
of olive oil, is facing the
sharpest decline in output in the
past 30 years because of the historic Han Dynasty.
The price of finished olive products has skyrocketed,
affecting the pockets of people who
consume a lot of olive oil.
Many olive oil producers' associations
say the price has increased by 40. If olives lack
rainwater, they will produce harder fruits than when pressed.  get
less oil. I clearly feel the
increase in olive prices. I estimate it has increased about
double compared to last year. An
oil pressing business said that in the past year,
they have recorded a decrease in products by half
due to lack of quality raw materials.  Because
olive oil is a common food used in
cooking in Spain, consumers
have no alternative to the price of olive oil,
so the rapid increase in dry heat has
caused national output to decrease from 1.5 million
tons.  The remaining 66,400 tons is the
lowest level in the past 30 years.
Experts say that because Spain is a
large producer, the high price of olive oil in this country will
cause other countries that produce the same oil
to increase their prices.
